page.title: 06Farming in Alvechurch
page.content: One of the farms in Alvechurch is called "Lea End". We talked to Mr Bushell the farmer. He was born in the village and went to the old school on the hill. He then went to Barnt Green and came back to live at the farm for 55 years. In 1979 he had to move out because of the motorway, and his land was required for its construction. His first reactions were anger and frustration. His farm was mainly arable, but the animals went first as the farm was sold. On the 1st August 1985 the remaining buildings and machinery will be auctioned. Other local farmers have suffered in a similar way as Mr Bushell as the M42 moves nearer the village.
